title: Israel, under fire from Iranian missiles, comes to standstill
subhead: NewsDespite the many projectiles intercepted by Israel, attacks launched by Iran on several Israeli cities have killed 16 people, injured 500, and damaged several neighborhoods and important military sites.

title: At the G7, it's Trump against the rest, in a chaotic world
subhead: As the leaders of the seven largest Western economies, plus the European Union, meet in Canada from Sunday, the divisions within what can hardly still be called the 'Western family' have been brought out into the open.

title: France shuts five Israeli booths at Paris Air Show for showcasing 'offensive weapons'
subhead: Black walls were installed around the stands of five Israeli defense firms at the trade fair on Monday, a decision Israel condemned as 'outrageous.'

title: Trump's messianic allies lead the charge against Gaza
subhead: The US president has rallied Christian fundamentalists, ideologically aligned with Israeli supremacists, in support of the multifaceted campaign to destroy Gaza, analyzes  Jean-Pierre Filiu in his column.

title: WhatsApp boss: Meta AI doesn't see your conversations, 'only the messages you send it'
subhead: Will Cathcart, head of Meta's subsidiary, announced the launch of WhatsApp channels with subscriptions and advertising. He says the rollout of artificial intelligence does not compromise the privacy of encrypted messaging.
byline: By Morgane Tual and Alexandre Piquard

title: Is it ever a good idea to... wear sunglasses on the top of your head?
subhead: In fashion as in life, it's important to know which lines you should not cross. Or at least to do so deliberately.

title: Israel-Iran: 'This conflict poses a dire threat to the very foundations of human civilization'
subhead: In an op-ed, prominent Iranian voices including Nobel Peace Prize laureates Narges Mohammadi and Shirin Ebadi and the filmmakers Jafar Panahi and Mohammad Rasoulof argue that the continuation of the nuclear program and the war between the Islamic Republic and Israel serve neither the interests of the Iranian people nor those of humanity.

title: Macron warms up for G7 with Greenland visit
subhead: The French president stated that the situation in the Danish autonomous territory, which Donald Trump has been coveting, was 'a warning sign for Europeans.'

title: Gaza rescuers say Israeli fire kills at least 20 queuing for food
subhead: A civil defense spokesman said that Israeli forces opened fire in the southern city of Rafah on Monday, where many were waiting to reach an aid distribution site.

title: Renault CEO Luca de Meo unexpectedly resigns, heading to Kering
subhead: The automaker announced on Sunday, June 15, that its chief executive had decided to step down after five years in the role. His departure will be effective July 15. He is expected to join the luxury conglomerate, which has been facing difficulties.
byline: By Sophie Fay and Juliette Garnier

title: Paris Air Show opens amid tense geopolitical context
subhead: The world's leading aerospace gathering, which kicks off on Monday, is overshadowed by the war in Ukraine and ongoing conflicts in the Middle East.

title: Nine suspected migrant smugglers go on trial in France over boat deaths
subhead: The eight suspects – Afghans and Kurds aged between 22 and 40 – are being tried in northern France, on charges of involuntary manslaughter by violating security obligations. Another suspect has not been caught and is being tried in absentia.

title: Togo suspends French broadcasters  for three months
subhead: Togo announced on Monday it was suspending RFI and France 24 for three months, accusing them of transmitting 'inexact and tendentious' content.

title: The young professionals taking their parents' experiences to heart and changing how they work
subhead: Between exhaustion, loss of meaning and admiration, a younger generation is constructing its relationship with work after witnessing their parents' professional struggles and the profound transformation of workplace dynamics.

title: Former French junior minister sentenced for harassment
subhead: Nathalie Elimas received a 10-month suspended sentence, was barred from holding elected office for three years and fined €5,000 on Monday.

title: Viktoria Krykunova's 'double punishment': A refugee from eastern Ukraine faces enemy collaboration charges
subhead: While living in the Russian-occupied hometown of Svatove, the young woman worked for an office tasked with distributing pensions, which were funded by Moscow, to residents. Ukrainian prosecutors have requested a seven-year prison sentence for her.

title: Trump orders ICE to ramp up deportation in Democratic cities, undeterred by protests
subhead: In a social media post, the US President called on immigration officials 'to do all in their power to achieve the very important goal of delivering the single largest Mass Deportation Program in History.'
byline: Le Monde with AP and AFP

title: Poland delivers Trump his first electoral victory in Europe
subhead: The EU's sixth-largest economy has returned to the conservative fold, now dominated by Donald Trump. Strongly backed by the MAGA movement, nationalist ultra-conservative candidate Karol Nawrocki won Poland's presidential election on June 1.

title: Louvre delays opening due to spontaneous union protest
subhead: Thousands of visitors were stuck in long queues outside the iconic Paris museum on Monday after staff held a protest over working conditions.

title: How the US divided Europe to invade Iraq at any cost in 2003
subhead: Investigation'The Transatlantic Divorce' (1/5). In the aftermath of September 11, American neoconservatives made plans to attack Iraq, despite opposition from France and Germany. From then on, to achieve its aims, the White House relied on its allies in Eastern Europe, dividing the European family for years to come.

title: The Islamic Republic of Iran, Netanyahu's favorite enemy for 30 years
subhead: Since his rise to prominence on the Israeli political stage in the early 1990s, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has repeatedly insisted that the regime in Tehran poses an 'existential threat' to Israel.

title: Was the Trump phenomenon a historical accident? Reinterpreting the history of the American right
subhead: InvestigationConvinced that political liberalism was deeply rooted in the US, American historians long downplayed the far right's influence within the conservative movement. In light of new historiography, Trump appears less a historical accident and more the result of a long gestation.

title: At the G7, it's Trump against the rest, in a chaotic world
subhead: As the leaders of the seven largest Western economies, plus the European Union, meet in Canada from Sunday, the divisions within what can hardly still be called the 'Western family' have been brought out into the open.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'Opponents of the tax on the ultra-wealthy lack historical perspective'
subhead: After France's Sénat voted against a 2% wealth tax for people whose worth exceeds €100 million, the economist argues that the scale of France's debt and funding needs for social and climate challenges will soon require even more radical redistributive measures.

title: The murder in France of a teaching assistant is a tragedy that defies stereotypes
subhead: The killing of Mélanie G. by a 14-year-old on June 10 should serve as a call to move beyond political instrumentalization and hollow promises of immediate 'solutions,' and instead launch a comprehensive prevention and education strategy for everyone – parents and teenagers alike.
